questionContent.body:
Scenario: A security analyst is reviewing packet captures from a corporate firewall. She observes multiple TCP connections to port 21 with separate control and data streams, along with username/password transmissions in plaintext.
Which protocol is being used, and what is the major security risk in this Scenario?

questionOptions.body: HTTP; uses GET requests for authentication

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The description fits FTP (File Transfer Protocol), which uses TCP port 21 for control and often a separate TCP port for data. Standard FTP transmits credentials in plaintext, making it susceptible to credential sniffing unless upgraded to FTPS or SFTP.

questionContent.body: Scenario: A financial services application requires guaranteed delivery, ordered packets, and error correction for transmitting sensitive data between the server and client. Which protocol best meets these requirements?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) provides reliable, connection-oriented communication with sequencing, acknowledgments, and retransmissions - essential for sensitive financial data.

questionContent.body: Scenario: A researcher accesses her home desktop PC from a remote location via a VPN. . Which type of network allows this functionality?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The VPN tunnel is established over a WAN, enabling secure remote access across long distances.

questionContent.body: Scenario: Two smart vehicles communicate directly using short-range wireless technologies to avoid a collision. What type of network is being formed between these vehicles?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: This is a Vehicular Ad-hoc Network, a subset of PAN, where nodes (vehicles) form temporary communication links.

questionContent.body: Scenario: In a small office with 15 desktop computers, a printer, and a local file server, all devices are interconnected via switches. What type of network is this?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The interconnection of devices in a single, limited area like an office falls under a LAN.

questionContent.body: Scenario: A city-wide surveillance system links all CCTV cameras via fiber optics within a single metropolitan area. What kind of network does this describe?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A Metropolitan Area Network (MAN) spans a city and is larger than a LAN but smaller than a WAN.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A data center in California is connected via fiber to another facility in Texas for backup and replication.
. What type of network is being used here?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Interconnecting distant data centers over fiber falls under WAN, as it spans across wide geographical boundaries.

questionContent.body: Scenario: A traveling executive connects a laptop to a mobile hotspot on their phone to send an urgent report.What type of network is formed between the phone and laptop?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The temporary, close-range connection between personal devices (phone and laptop) forms a PAN using Wi-Fi or Bluetooth tethering.

questionContent.body: Scenario: A smart home system connects lighting, thermostats, and security devices using Zigbee and Wi-Fi within the premises. This network is best classified as:

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Although some devices use PAN-like protocols (Zigbee), the entire interconnected home network within a building qualifies as a LAN.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A company has offices in New York, London, and Tokyo, all interconnected to share databases and applications in real-time.
This configuration best describes what type of network?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A Wide Area Network (WAN) connects geographically distant sites using leased lines, satellites, or public networks.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A consulting professional syncs data between their smartwatch, smartphone, and wireless earbuds within a range of 2 meters.
What type of network is being used?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A Personal Area Network (PAN) connects devices in close proximity, often within a few meters, typically using Bluetooth or IR.

questionContent.body: Scenario A university deploys a network across all classrooms and administrative offices within a single campus using Ethernet and WiFi Which type of network does this setup best represent

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A Local Area Network LAN connects devices within a limited area like a university campus using highspeed wiredwireless connections

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A real-time stock ticker app streams updates from a financial data server. The developers chose a protocol that avoids connection setup to reduce latency. However, occasional packet loss and unordered data are reported.

Q2. Which protocol is being used and why is this behavior acceptable for this application?

questionOptions.body: TCP; because it ensures reliable delivery
FTP; because it supports large file downloads
UDP; because low latency is prioritized over reliability
HTTP; because it's stateless and can handle bursts

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: UDP is used in real-time applications like stock tickers or VoIP, where speed is more critical than accuracy. Occasional packet loss and unordered delivery are acceptable trade-offs for avoiding the overhead of connection setup and acknowledgments.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A user types a website URL in the browser, initiating a request to a remote web server. The response includes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files.
Which protocol manages this client-server transaction, and at which OSI layer does it primarily operate?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is used for web communication and operates at the Application Layer (Layer 7) of the OSI model. It relies on TCP underneath for transport.

questionContent.body: Scenario: A content delivery network (CDN) utilizes IP multicast to send identical video streams to multiple receivers simultaneously without establishing individual connections. Which combination of protocols is most suitable for this use-case?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Multicast transmission relies on UDP over IP because UDP is connectionless and suitable for broadcast-like operations, reducing overhead for many-to-one streaming.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A network admin notices that a user is downloading multiple large files from a web browser and simultaneously uploading a report through a file transfer client.
Which protocols are most likely in use during this [type=text]
 Scenario?

questionOptions.body: TCP for both FTP and HTTP
UDP for HTTP, TCP for FTP
HTTP for downloading, IP for uploading
FTP for downloading, HTTP for uploading

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Both FTP and HTTP use TCP because they require reliable and ordered delivery. FTP handles file uploads/downloads, and HTTP supports web-based downloads.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A live online gaming platform reports delayed packet delivery and unpredictable jitter. The developers state they intentionally chose a connectionless protocol to avoid retransmission overhead.

Which protocol is most likely being used for real-time transmission, and why?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: UDP (User Datagram Protocol) is connectionless and doesn't guarantee delivery, making it ideal for real-time applications like gaming where low latency is more critical than reliability.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A client uploads a file via FTP, which requires establishing a connection, managing the session, and handling reliable data delivery.

Which combination of OSI layers are actively involved in this FTP transaction?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
Application Layer (Layer 7): FTP protocol functionality.

Session Layer (Layer 5): Maintains the session.

Transport Layer (Layer 4): Ensures reliable data delivery (typically via TCP).

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A network analyzer captures data frames that include both destination MAC addresses and physical transmission details.

These elements are handled by which OSI layer(s)?

questionOptions.body: Both Physical and Data Link Layers

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Physical Layer (Layer 1) manages actual signal transmission, while the Data Link Layer (Layer 2) handles MAC addressing and framing.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: During a video call, one participant notices significant lag and jitter. A network engineer diagnoses the problem as a lack of proper flow control and congestion management.Which OSI layer is most responsible for flow control and congestion handling in this [type=text]
 Scenario?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Transport Layer (Layer 4) manages end-to-end communication, including flow control, error recovery, and congestion avoidance (e.g., via TCP).

questionContent.body: Scenario: A packet arrives at a router and is forwarded to the next hop based on its destination IP address.According to the TCP/IP model, which layer is responsible for this routing functionality?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Internet Layer in the TCP/IP model (equivalent to the OSI's Network Layer) handles IP addressing and routing decisions.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A user initiates a secure HTTPS request to a banking website. The browser verifies the server�s digital certificate before proceeding.

In the context of the OSI model, which layer is primarily responsible for SSL/TLS encryption and certificate validation?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Presentation Layer (Layer 6) of the OSI model handles encryption, decryption, and data translation, including SSL/TLS operations like certificate validation.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A hospital network ensures all patient data is encrypted during transmission between departments.
Which networking goal is being prioritized?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The encryption of data ensures confidentiality and integrity, meeting the security objective of networking.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A disaster recovery plan involves data replication to a remote site every 5 minutes over a dedicated link.What critical goal of networking is this [type=text]
 Scenario primarily addressing?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Replicating data at a remote site ensures redundancy, a networking goal to avoid data loss in case of failure.

questionContent.body: Scenario: An educational institute sets up a campus-wide Wi-Fi network allowing students to access the internet and internal servers uniformly.Which networking principle is being upheld by providing equal access throughout the campus?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Ensuring consistent access across users focuses on availability, a key networking goal ensuring services are reachable when needed.

questionContent.body: Scenario: A startup uses cloud-based virtual machines to allow employees to work from different geographical locations using shared tools and environments.This setup best demonstrates which of the following networking goals?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Networking enables access to remote resources, such as virtual machines and cloud applications, fulfilling the goal of resource accessibility.

questionContent.body:
Scenario: A multinational corporation needs to establish communication among its branches across different continents to facilitate collaborative product development and real-time video conferencing.
What is the primary networking goal addressed in the corporation's setup?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: While all options are networking goals, the key focus in this case is enabling real-time interaction across locations, which relates directly to the communication goal of networking.

questionContent.body: Which component ensures communication in a wireless network

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Wi Fi adapters allow wireless connectivity

questionContent.body: Which protocol assigns no guarantee of packet delivery

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: IP is a best effort delivery protocol and does not guarantee packet delivery or order

questionContent.body: Which of the following protocols is stateless

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
HTTP is stateless 
 meaning it does not retain information about previous interactions

questionContent.body: Which protocol is best suited for real time video or audio streaming

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: UDP is used in real time services like video audio streaming where speed is preferred over reliability

questionContent.body: What does FTP stand for

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol and is used to move files between systems

questionContent.body: Which protocol works with IP to ensure reliable communication

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP is often paired with IP (as TCP IP) to provide reliable communication over the Internet

questionContent.body: What is the main use of HTTP

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is used to access and transfer web content like HTML pages

questionContent.body: Which protocol is commonly used for transferring files between computers

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is specifically designed for uploading and downloading files over a network

questionContent.body: Which of the following protocols is connectionless and faster but less reliable

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
UDP (User Datagram Protocol) does not establish a connection 
 making it faster but less reliable than TCP

questionContent.body:
Which protocol provides reliable 
 connection oriented data delivery

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) ensures reliable communication through error checking and acknowledgment

questionContent.body: Which protocol is responsible for assigning logical addresses and routing data packets

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Internet Protocol (IP) is used for addressing and routing packets across networks

questionContent.body:
Which layer in the OSI model establishes 
 manages 
 and terminates sessions

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Session layer is responsible for establishing 
 maintaining 
 and closing communication sessions

questionContent.body: The Application layer in the OSI model provides

questionOptions.body: User interface and network services to applications

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Application layer enables end user services such as email 
 file transfer 
 and web browsing

questionContent.body: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for logical addressing and routing

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Network layer handles IP addressing and path determination

questionContent.body: What is the main responsibility of the Physical layer in the OSI model

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Physical layer deals with transmission of raw bits over a medium (e g  
 cables 
 signals)

questionContent.body: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for end to end communication and error recovery

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Transport layer handles reliable delivery 
 sequencing 
 and error recovery

questionContent.body:
Which layer in the OSI model establishes 
 manages 
 and terminates sessions

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Session layer is responsible for establishing 
 maintaining 
 and closing communication sessions

questionContent.body: The Application layer in the OSI model provides

questionOptions.body: User interface and network services to applications

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Application layer enables end user services such as email 
 file transfer 
 and web browsing

questionContent.body: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for logical addressing and routing

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Network layer handles IP addressing and path determination

questionContent.body: What is the main responsibility of the Physical layer in the OSI model

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Physical layer deals with transmission of raw bits over a medium (e g  
 cables 
 signals)

questionContent.body: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for end to end communication and error recovery

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
The Transport layer handles reliable delivery 
 sequencing 
 and error recovery

questionContent.body: In the TCP/IP model, which layer is responsible for logical addressing and routing?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Internet Layer (Layer 2 in TCP/IP) manages logical addressing (IP) and routing.

questionContent.body: Which of the following layers is not present in the TCP/IP model?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP/IP combines Session, Presentation, and Application into one Application Layer.

questionContent.body: Which protocol uses port 80 by default and is used for accessing web pages?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is used to transfer web content and uses port 80 by default.

questionContent.body: How many TCP connections are established in a typical FTP session (active or passive mode)?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: FTP uses two TCP connections: one for control and one for data transfer. This separation allows parallel control and data communication.

questionContent.body: Which protocol is used to transfer files between a client and a server over a network?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is specifically designed for transferring files and supports user authentication and directory operations.

questionContent.body: Which of the following protocols is connectionless and used for faster data transmission without reliability guarantees?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: UDP (User Datagram Protocol) is faster and suitable for real-time applications like video streaming, but does not guarantee delivery or order.

questionContent.body: Which protocol ensures reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data between applications?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) is a connection-oriented protocol that ensures reliable communication using acknowledgments, sequencing, and retransmissions.

questionContent.body: A network engineer needs to trace physical cable issues. Which OSI layer is involved?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Physical Layer deals with the actual hardware transmission media (cables, connectors).

questionContent.body: If 1,000 segments are sent over TCP and 5 are lost, how many acknowledgments are expected (assuming cumulative ACKs)?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP expects acknowledgment for each segment sent, regardless of loss (which will trigger retransmission).

questionContent.body: Which of the following is not a function of the Transport Layer?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Logical addressing is handled by the Network Layer, not the Transport Layer.

questionContent.body: Which layer in the OSI model is responsible for physical addressing?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Data Link Layer uses MAC addresses to identify devices on the same network segment.

questionContent.body: Which layer of TCP/IP corresponds to the Transport Layer of the OSI model?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Host-to-Host Layer in TCP/IP is equivalent to the Transport Layer in OSI, providing end-to-end communication.

questionContent.body: At which OSI layer do switches primarily operate?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Switches operate at Layer 2 (Data Link Layer), using MAC addresses to forward data.

questionContent.body: Which layer of the OSI model translates data between the application and the network formats?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Presentation Layer handles data translation, encryption, and compression.

questionContent.body: Which OSI layer is responsible for error detection and correction?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Data Link Layer ensures error-free transfer of data frames between two nodes.

questionContent.body: Which protocol operates at the Transport Layer of the TCP/IP model?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) ensures reliable data transmission and operates at the Transport Layer.

questionContent.body: In the OSI model, which layer is responsible for routing?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Network Layer handles logical addressing and routing packets between networks.

questionContent.body: Which OSI layer is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating connections between applications?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Session Layer controls dialogues (connections) between computers. It establishes, manages, and terminates connections.

questionContent.body: Which of these networks would use leased telephone lines to communicate between distant cities?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: WANs often use leased lines or telecom infrastructure to span large geographic distances, such as between cities or countries.

questionContent.body: If a network has a speed of 1 Gbps and covers a distance of 50 meters between devices, what type of network is most likely in use?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A 1 Gbps speed and 50-meter range suggests a wired LAN (e.g., Ethernet), ideal for offices or labs.

questionContent.body: Which of the following is true about LANs?

questionOptions.body: They are immune to electromagnetic interference.
They typically operate within a single building.

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: LANs are designed for use in small, contained areas like a single building, and do not use satellite communication.

questionContent.body: A company wants to connect its headquarters in New York with its branch in Tokyo. Which type of network should be used?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: WAN is the best option for connecting remote offices across continents, often using leased lines or satellite links.

questionContent.body: Which network type generally requires the most infrastructure investment?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: WANs span large areas and typically involve leasing communication lines, making them the most expensive to build and maintain.

questionContent.body: Which network type would be most suitable for connecting a smartwatch to a smartphone?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: PAN is ideal for personal devices in close proximity, such as wearables connected via Bluetooth.

questionContent.body: Which of the following is not a feature of LAN?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: LANs are limited to small geographic areas and are privately owned. Large geographic coverage is a characteristic of WANs.

questionContent.body: Which of the following best describes a WAN?

questionOptions.body: A network connecting computers within a single room
A network connecting computers across cities or countries
A network within a home using Bluetooth

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: WAN (Wide Area Network) connects geographically distant locations, like the internet or a corporate intranet spread across the globe.

questionContent.body: A university campus with multiple interconnected buildings is best served by which type of network?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A LAN (Local Area Network) is suitable for small geographic areas like a campus or office, offering high speed and reliability.

questionContent.body: Which of the following networks covers the shortest range?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: PAN (Personal Area Network) typically covers a range of a few meters, such as Bluetooth or USB connections between personal devices.

questionContent.body: Which of these best reflects the scalability goal of a computer network?

questionOptions.body: Reducing network speed as more devices connect
Adding new devices without affecting existing services
Making the network closed and secure

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Scalability refers to the network's ability to grow and manage increased demand without negatively impacting performance.

questionContent.body: In the context of networking, what does resource sharing imply?

questionOptions.body: Allowing multiple users to access printers, storage, and software over a network
Using multiple CPUs on a single system
Allocating all resources to one user

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Resource sharing in networking allows different users and systems to access common devices and services like printers, storage, and applications.

questionContent.body: What is the main goal of networking when it comes to fault tolerance?

questionOptions.body: To reduce cost of the system
To ensure system remains operational if part fails

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Fault tolerance ensures the system continues to function even if a component fails. This is a crucial goal in networking to maintain service availability.

questionContent.body: Which of the following is NOT a goal of computer networking?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: One of the key goals of networking is to enable distributed computing, not centralized computing. It emphasizes the use of multiple computers to improve performance and reliability.

questionContent.body: Which protocol works on the Transport Layer, is connection-oriented, and uses three-way handshake to establish a connection?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) is connection-oriented and establishes a reliable connection using a three-way handshake (SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK).

questionContent.body: Which protocol is responsible for delivering packets to the correct destination IP address but does not guarantee delivery?

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: IP (Internet Protocol) provides logical addressing and routing of packets but does not guarantee delivery or order of packets.

questionContent.body: Which type of network is most suitable for a small office

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: LAN is ideal for small offices as it efficiently connects a limited number of computers

questionContent.body: A LAN can be connected to a WAN using a

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A router connects a local area network (LAN) to a wide area network (WAN)

questionContent.body: A Bluetooth connection between a phone and wireless earphones is an example of

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Bluetooth connections between nearby devices form a PAN

questionContent.body: Which of the following networks is typically the smallest in size

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
PAN is the smallest type 
 typically covering just a few meters around a person

questionContent.body: Which network type is used for communication within a city

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: MAN (Metropolitan Area Network) connects networks across a city

questionContent.body: Which of the following is an example of a LAN

questionOptions.body: A smartwatch connected to a phone

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A school LAN connects computers within a limited area such as classrooms or labs

questionContent.body: The Internet is an example of which type of network

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The Internet is a Wide Area Network (WAN) as it spans the globe

questionContent.body: PAN is best described as a network that

questionOptions.body: Connects devices around a single person

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
PAN (Personal Area Network) connects devices like smartphones 
 tablets 
 and smartwatches around one person

questionContent.body: Which network type is typically used to connect computers in a single building

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
LAN (Local Area Network) connects computers in a small area such as a home 
 office 
 or building

questionContent.body: Which of the following is an example of a LAN

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: LAN connects systems within a small area like an office

questionContent.body: WAN stands for

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: WAN connects computers across large geographical distances

questionContent.body: Which of these is a major goal of computer networking

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Enabling efficient communication is a key networking goal

questionContent.body: What is resource sharing in networking

questionOptions.body: Sharing physical and logical resources among computers

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
It refers to sharing printers 
 files 
 and applications

questionContent.body: Which of the following is a benefit of computer networks

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
Networks allow centralized management 
 reducing redundancy

questionContent.body: The main purpose of networking is

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details:
Networking allows sharing of files 
 printers 
 and internet connections

questionContent.body: What does LAN stand for

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: LAN connects computers within a small geographical area like a building

questionContent.body: Which component is necessary to form a computer network

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: NIC enables a computer to connect to a network

questionContent.body: A major use of computer networks is

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: File sharing is one of the primary uses of networking

questionContent.body: What is a computer network

questionOptions.body: A group of connected computers that can share data
A single computer with many users

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A computer network is a group of interconnected computers that can communicate and share resources
